snippet.textDisplay: Actually, I knew as soon as it started (I have this playing in the background while I play my Game) and I have never played a Single Castlevania game in my life, and only watched someone play a few short hours of one.

snippet.textDisplay:
0:47-1:11 is what gave it away from me besides the sting notes.  That type of key transition is shown in almost every Castlevania song..

The organ arpeggiations at 1:51 does carry over in alot of castlevania songs too.
snippet.textOriginal:
0:47-1:11 is what gave it away from me besides the sting notes.  That type of key transition is shown in almost every Castlevania song..

The organ arpeggiations at 1:51 does carry over in alot of castlevania songs too.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not a big fan of Lament of Innocence. It had some good music, and gameplay but it was rather short, and the controls felt a little stiff. Maybe it's just me. SCIV had good music but not the best. For me SOTN has the best and Curse of Darkness the 2nd best. But SCIV would probably be 3rd :D
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not a big fan of Lament of Innocence. It had some good music, and gameplay but it was rather short, and the controls felt a little stiff. Maybe it's just me. SCIV had good music but not the best. For me SOTN has the best and Curse of Darkness the 2nd best. But SCIV would probably be 3rd :D

snippet.textDisplay:
@Smarty4789 

boooO!


Lament of Innocence had best gameplay (soon to be beaten by LOS)
Symphony of the Night had best map/original story
CV-IV forever will have the best music. Come on! Theme of Simon simply beats Bloody Tears on originality, complexity, and epicness...but even CV-IV has the best Bloody Tears out of them all.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Smarty4789 

boooO!


Lament of Innocence had best gameplay (soon to be beaten by LOS)
Symphony of the Night had best map/original story
CV-IV forever will have the best music. Come on! Theme of Simon simply beats Bloody Tears on originality, complexity, and epicness...but even CV-IV has the best Bloody Tears out of them all.

snippet.textDisplay: Now I disagree. SCIV is the better game when it comes to gameplay(whipping in 8 directions is the best thing that ever happened in the series). But when it comes to soundtrack, I'm sorry but you can't compete with Symphony of Night.
snippet.textOriginal: Now I disagree. SCIV is the better game when it comes to gameplay(whipping in 8 directions is the best thing that ever happened in the series). But when it comes to soundtrack, I'm sorry but you can't compete with Symphony of Night.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree. The filler started the whole problem for me and it has ruined the experience. I wish they started with 2 weeks per episode, that way, they would have kept with the manga and even had better animation and story and personality development. But the filler definitely was the reason why I lost interest.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree. The filler started the whole problem for me and it has ruined the experience. I wish they started with 2 weeks per episode, that way, they would have kept with the manga and even had better animation and story and personality development. But the filler definitely was the reason why I lost interest.

snippet.textDisplay: The game has a great OST.  It is nowhere near the best Castlevania game or nowhere near the worst, it's a decent try for a 3D Castlevania, as was Lament of Innocence.  Much better than the crap on the N64.  OST is a buy, the game is most likely a weekend rental.
snippet.textOriginal: The game has a great OST.  It is nowhere near the best Castlevania game or nowhere near the worst, it's a decent try for a 3D Castlevania, as was Lament of Innocence.  Much better than the crap on the N64.  OST is a buy, the game is most likely a weekend rental.
